page.title: 05SHEFFIELD CANAL
page.content: Completed in 1819 at a cost of Â£104,719 the canal is 4 miles long. It stretches from the canal basin along the industrial{Don Valley}to the seven Tinsley Locks 4ml. distant,and beyond. In the 19th. century steelworks, rolling mills and foundries were built along its banks. In 1985 only the rolling mill near Salmon Pastures remains operational,Hadfield and Brown Baileys steelworks have gone. Seven road and three rail bridges cross the canal. Tow-rope marks can be seen on many of these. An aquaduct crosses Darnall Road. Blackburn Meadows pumping station was demolished in 1978, now the only supply of water is from the disused Nunnery Colliery. Today the canal is only used by occasional anglers, pleasure-boats and naturalists.{Landscaping}plans are in hand.
